Case Name: Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site, Inc.
Labor Union1: United Steel, Paper and Forestry, Rubber, Manufacturing, Energy, Allied & Industrial Service Workers International Union, AFL CIO, CLC
Union to Certify: United Steel, Paper and Forestry, Rubber, Manufacturing, Energy, Allied & Industrial Service Workers International Union, AFL CIO, CLC
Voting Unit (Unit A):
VOTING GROUP A-Professional Employees

Included: All full-time and regular part-time manager-accounting employees, specialist-marketing and digital media employees, and senior specialist-marketing and communications employees employed by the Employer at its 653 N. 22nd Street, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania location. 

Excluded: All other employees, managerial employees, specialist membership employees, senior specialist research and public programming employees, employees solely employed during Halloween Nights, non-professional employees, guards, and supervisors as defined in the Act.

VOTING GROUP B-Non-Professional Employees

Included: All full-time and regular part-time event team staff, visitor services staff, education staff, senior specialist-advancement services and analytics employees, administrative and guest support assistant employees, facilities maintenance technicians, and facilities technicians employed by the Employer at its 2027 Fairmount Avenue, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania facility.  

Excluded: All other employees, managerial employees, employees solely employed during Halloween Nights, professional employees, guards, and supervisors as defined in the Act.

Others permitted to vote: The parties have agreed that the classifications listed below may vote in the election but their ballots will be challenged since their eligibility has not been resolved.  No decision has been made regarding whether the individuals in these classifications or groups are included in, or excluded from, the bargaining unit.  The eligibility or inclusion of these individuals will be resolved, if necessary, following the election.
Non-Professionals: Visitor Service Leads

If a majority of the professional employees voting in Voting Group A vote "Yes" to the first question, indicating their desire to be included in a unit with non-professional employees, they will be so included, and their votes on the second question will be counted together with the votes of the non-professional employees in Voting Group B to determine whether or not  United Steel, Paper and Forestry, Rubber, Manufacturing, Energy, Allied & Industrial Service Workers International Union, AFL CIO, CLC will represent an overall unit consisting of the employees in Voting Groups A and B.  If, on the other hand, a majority of the professional employees voting in Voting Group A do not vote "Yes" to the first question, their ballots will be counted separately to determine whether they will be represented by United Steel, Paper and Forestry, Rubber, Manufacturing, Energy, Allied & Industrial Service Workers International Union, AFL CIO, CLC in a separate unit of professional employees.

If a majority of the professional employees voting in Unit A vote "Yes" to the first question, indicating their desire to be included in a unit with non-professional employees, they will be so included, and their votes on the second question will be counted together with the votes of the non-professional employees in Unit B to decide the question concerning representation for the overall unit consisting of the employees in Units A and B. If on the other hand, a majority of the professional employees voting in Unit A do not vote "Yes" to the first question, their ballots will be counted separately to decide the question concerning representation in a separate Unit A.

Voting Unit (Unit A):
The election will be conducted in part by mail.  The mail ballots will be mailed to all Program Aide employees who regularly report to work at individuals’ homes instead of the Employer’s Vineland, NJ facility.  The mail ballots will be mailed from the office of the National Labor Relations Board, Region 4, on Monday, August 14, 2017 after 3:00 p.m.  Voters must return their mail ballots so that they will be received in the National Labor Relations Board, Region 4 office by close of business on August 28, 2017.  The mail ballots will be counted at the Region 4 office located at 615 Chestnut St Ste 710, Philadelphia, PA 19106-4413 at 2:00 p.m. on Tuesday, August 29, 2017.
If any eligible voter does not receive a mail ballot or otherwise requires a duplicate mail ballot kit, he or she should contact the Region 4 office by no later 5:00 p.m. on Monday, August 21, 2017 in order to arrange for another mail ballot kit to be sent to that employee.

All full-time and regular part-time journeymen and apprentice plasterers employed by the Employer on its projects located in the Counties of Allegheny, Armstrong, Beaver, Bedford, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Cameron, Centre, Clarion, Clearfield, Clinton, Crawford, Elk, Fayette, Forest, Greene, Huntingdon, Indiana, Jefferson, Lawrence, McKean, Mercer, Mifflin, Potter, Somerset, Veanago, Warren, Washington and Westmoreland, Pennsylvania; excluding all office clerical employees and guards, professional employees and supervisors as defined in the Act, and all other employees*

*In accord with the Board's holdings in Daniel Construction Company, Inc., 133 NLRB 264 (1961), as modified at 167 NLRB 1078 (1967), and Steiny and Company, Inc., 308 NLRB 1323 (1992), in addition to those employees eligible to vote under the standard criteria, unit employees are eligible to vote if they have been employed in the unit for either (1) a total of 30 days or more within the 12 months preceding the payroll period for eligibility or, (2) if they have had some employment in those 12 months and have been employed for a total of 45 days or more within the 24-month period immediately preceding the payroll period for eligibility, and who have not quit or been discharged for cause prior to the payroll period for eligibility.
